title: Understanding Electron Configuration
text: The electron configuration $$\operatorname{[Ar]}\left(4s^2\right) 3d^{10} 4p^4$$ represents the distribution of electrons in an atom. The numbers and letters indicate the energy levels, sublevels, and the number of electrons in each sublevel.

title: Identify the Element
text: The electron configuration ends with $$4p^4$$. This means the element is in the $$p-block$$ of the periodic table, specifically in the 4th period and 16th group.

title: Locate the Element on the Periodic Table
text: Using the periodic table, find the element in the 4th period and 16th group. This will help you identify the chemical symbol.
